runs.comm: short of a length outside off, hits the deck hard, negotiated to the off side off the back foot
fuller and slightly wider, Kamra reaches out and guides it down square. He is up and away
straighter this time, angling in, worked away to mid on off the back foot
Boom! Pitched up outside off, Butt leans forward, frees his arms and times it to a nicety, in the air over wide mid on. Shades of Saeed Anwar!
shortens the length, Butt stays back and guides it towards third man
slips down the leg and will have to bowl one more to finish the over
drifts on to Kamran's pads but he can't capitalise. Half shout as it drifts to the leg side for a leg bye
short of a length angling in, worked awat to mid on but can't find the gap
swept away nicely! Akmal moved across, plonked the front foot across and swung high towards square leg
same shot, made easier by the bowler drifting on to his legs, Kamran said thanks as he swept finer for four more.
finally gets line and length right, Kamran looks to nurdle one to point but cannot get the gap
always a run-out chance when Butt is around! Hit off the back foot to the fielder at midwicket and Butt was away in a hurry. Kamran sends him back, a direct hit might have helped
swung away aggressively towards midwicket, in the air for a single. Average over from Razzak.
great line and length from Mortaza, and a shade of away movement as well. Kamran was not to the pitch and played on the up, missed the outside edge by little
fuller this time and Kamran unfurls the full blooded drill down the ground - does not time it too well though
wide outside Butts off stump, and the cut behind point is his bread-and-butter shot. He cannot find the point boundary though, on this occasion

dropped by Ashraful! Kamran was in no position for the pull-swing, went through with the shot and got a thickish top edge over mid on. Ashraful was back-pedalling and got a hand to it, out-stretched nehind him, but it did not stick. Tough one.
better pull this time, controlled and along the ground towards square leg
nicely played! Butt was down the track, making room as he sashayed down, opened up the off side and found the gap with his expansive cut. Left-hander's grace all over it!
short of a length outside off, Kamran looks to heave and cleave through point, but has no room to free his arms
on Butt's pads, he's a little early on the flick and gets a leading edge that goes back towards the bowler who tumbles to his left to make a good save
Butt gets forward and punches through the line between mid-on and midwicket who makes a half-stop. He is looking good here
length ball on middle and off, gets forward and drives straight to cover
slower ball, but short and poorly directed. Kamran got inside the line and pulled it away well behind square. Easy four runs
re-programs the radar and gets it outside off, Kamran cuts it away square
bad luck for Mortaza, good yorker, beat Kamran all ends up, but he managed to squeeze it down to fine leg off the inside edge
another good yorker, this time Kamran digs it out towards point
more luck going Pakistan's way. Slower ball, short of a length, decieving Butt who inside-edged the cut and it went perilously close to the furniture

no luck involved this time! At times, when Butt times the ball so well, one wonders if he does justice to his talent. Down the track, played through the line, all timing over mid off, couple of bounces to the boundary
good reply, shortens the length, pegs Butt back and he tries to guide it square on the off side
more variation, nice and full slower ball, Butt spots it but does not time or place the square drive too well
full on leg stump, following the batsman who digs it out to mid off
Bangladesh have worked hard on their lengths in the last couple of overs. Another good yorker and Kamran plays it back
full again, just short of yorker length, Kamran can't make good contact as he looks to cover drive
shortens the length and reduces the pace, Kamran gets forward and waits. Opens the face and runs it straight to short third man
extremely well played! Tries another yorker, but this time it is a low full toss on leg stump, Kamran opens up the off side and plays it inside out through the covers
tries a dangerous sweep to another full ball on middle and leg, gets it away behind square on the leg. Stifled appeal, but umpire says not out.
looped outside off, worked away behind square straight to the fielder
sliced away and lots of luck! Sees Kamran jumping out and shortens the length, Kamran takes him on and cannot make good connection, it balloons over the off side cordon
Butt this time, does better with the carve over the covers, but there is a sweeper in the deep
tries to cut, can't time it and gets a thick outside edge very fine. Nice fielding keeps it down to one
finally some timing this over! Butt goes for a sweep as the ball drifts down the leg and times it perfectly
on middle and off this time, he comes forward and drives towards deep cover
short of a length, straightening from off stump, worked away towards midwicket. Sends Kamran back very very late
goes towards deep square leg this time off a similar ball
mowed from well outside off towards deep midwicket for one
Butt comes down the track and almost yorks himself. Can't do much with it after that
Butt breaks the shackles! He comes down again, but ensured he would have room even if it was full. He did, and punched it strongly down the ground over Shakib's head and it ran away for four
wonderful shot, this time from Kamran, who opened up the off side, and unleashed his wrists to send that to deep point boundary in a trice
down the track, and goes for an almighty hoick towards midwicket
stays back this time and goes high over the off side, between long off and cover for a couple
very full on off stump, Kamran tries hard to muscle it away to the off side
Butt opens the face this time and wrists it in pleasing fashion into the off side
short and drifting on to leg, Kamran pulls hard but hits the ball a tad early, and finds wide mid on. He missed out on a freebie there

placed expertly by Butt! These are not easy boundaries to clear and placement is of utmost importance. Butt does that and swings well between midwicket and the square leg fielder, who converge but can't stop the boundary
through the off side this time, stays back and cuts behind square
Butt moves towards the leg side, but the bowler sticks to his guns and bowls it full on middle, driven down to long off
full on Kamran's middle and leg, he drives it straight down for a single
sweeps it off leg stump, half-fielded by short fine leg, who parries it to the sweeper running in, and they pick a single
that's the cleanest hit you will see today! Poor ball from Razzak, length ball on the leg stump, Salman picked it early went down on a knee and muscled it flat but well beyond the midwicket ropes!
sweeps again, but only for a single.
cut away to the deep to turn the strike over to Butt
another big hit towards midwicket, but because of the big field cannot find the boundary, and for the same reason does not hole out to the boundary rider either
cut away nicely towards cover
stays back and punches it down to wide mid off for a single. Ominous signs for Bangladesh. Great going for Pakistan here.
short and drifting on to the pads from Shuvo, but Kamran can't exact full toll on it
cuts away this time behind square
Salman has chosen his spot and once again sends one to his favourite part of the ground! Stays back and pull-sweeps powerfully over the ropes. Top shot
and that's fifty for Butt. Drives down the ground and gets to the landmark ahead of his opening partner. Well played!
Kamran joins him there now, not to be outdone! Gets down the track and hits powerfully over the bowler's head, it goes really straight. Couple of bounces and over the ropes.
full on off, driven back to the bowler
jumps out this time and drives expansively towards deep extra cover
full on middle and off, Kamran does well to dig it out to deep point
clears his leg and lofts over mid off, on the bounce to long off
frees his arms, opens the wrists and goes inside out over covers, timed extremely well and it landed just short of the rope
shortens the length this time, Kamran stays back and muscles it towards deep cover
full on middle and leg, Kamran pulls out a violent and gets it down to midwicket

another top shot from Butt who is looking increasingly better! This was short and wide outside off, turning into him, but he did very well to open up the off side and go through the line, over cover and into the gap
sweeps it away this time, straight to the deep square leg
down the track, looks to carve through the off side but only gets a single
another sweep from Butt, down to midwicket

nice improvisation, and in the context average bowling. Kamran's initial movement was to get inside the line of the ball, and the bowler played into his hands by spraying it on leg stump. Kamran gladly hoicked it behind square leg for four.
full on leg, Salman looks to come down and ends up yorking himself, but still has enough skill to wrist it down to square leg

super duper shot from Kamran Akmal! Short of a length outside off stump, he cleared his front foot out of the way and swung in awesome fashion, inside out over the cover boundary. Timing was of the essence in that shot!
another carve through the off side, not as good timing as last time, gets a single, square
Butt tees off this time, short of a length, he clears the front foot and pulls well in front of square, straight to the fielder in the deep

Kamran insists on going through the off side, even this time, when he had moved well towards the leg side and the bowler followed him, cramping him completely for room. Still muscles it down to wide long off
improvisation! Butt walks across his stumps and converts what would have been a yorker on leg stump, into a full toss down the leg, and easily flicks it away for four between square leg and fine leg.
clears the front foot and looks to go over long off, times it not so well, and it goes one bounce to the fielder at long off
full toss on leg, somehow escapes punishment. Swept in the air, straight to deep square leg on the bounce
very full outside off, bunted off the back foot towards extra cover
square driven by Butt, from full outside off stump, towards the sweeper

wicket against the run of play, finally Bangladesh have a wicket. Kamran did the basics right, came down the track and converted it into a full toss. He could have put it away anywhere, but he has had a preference for the carve over cover today. Goes for the same shot again, and mistimes it, it pops up for a straight forward chance at point. Good innings from Kamran, though not the most pleasing to the eye
Boom Boom Afridi gets forward and begins with a slap down to deep midwicket for a single. He keeps strike, this could be fun!
good yorker on middle and leg, Afridi digs it out for a single down to long on and gives Butt the strike. Disappointment.
and Butt turns it right back to his captain. Full on his leg, he does well to drive it without much room to cover
whoa, interesting all round! Afridi was ready for a scoop shot, the bowler saw his movement and banged it in real short making Afridi look a tad sheepish. Called one for the over
big swing and a miss outside off, the fielder at point would have felt a stiff breeze. Swish!
short this time, and Afridi looks to launch it straight, hits it straight up and it lands safe
again all muscle no timing, Afridi carves it high over the off side and just over the head of the cover fielder
full on middle and off, swept away powerfully to deep midwicket
wider this time outside off, Butt reaches out and gets it away into the cover region
full and wide outside off, Afridi gets down on a knee and looks to crunch the cover drive, but can only get a couple
full and outside off again, Afridi can only get a single off the front foot into the covers
driven by Butt down the ground towards long on
and that's the end of Afridi. Harmless looping full toss on off stump, it was Afridi's ball to whack and he ended up getting a feeble outside edge that ballooned to short third man.
nice improvisation again from Butt, moves outside off and swings the full toss down to square leg, where Imrul Kayes puts in a very good tumble to save the boundary

done in by his own cheek! Butt is roaming all over the crease looking to work it away using the bowler's pace. This time, he exposes his stumps and Shafiul finds a way past his defence to strike timber. End of a really good innings, he hardly struggled for timing on a difficult pitch
bouncer first up to Misbah, who is hurried into his pull shot, but gets it down along the ground to midwicket
thickish outside edge, but unfortunately for Razzaq, it goes straight to short third man
Misbah walks across, looks to lap it away, makes reasonably good contact and then comically falls down at the crease, overbalancing. They still get a couple. What's with the ul-Haqs and clumsiness!
slower ball, Misbah picks it, comes out his crease, waits and muscles it well wide of long on for two more.
very wide outside off and lucky to get away with it
looks to launch it over cover, but it a failed attempt. Balloons away for a couple
powerfully struck this time, wide of long off

makes room and clears his foot away, muscles it hard down the ground but still can't find the boundary. The ropes are atleast 10 metres further behind here as compared to the IPL. I daresay, it is good for the game this way
driven hard down the ground again, towards long on for a single
the last ball typifies the innings. Another full toss, another charge down the track and an aggressive hit, and again not timed that well, but well enough for a scapered couple.
